adjective.description: Having many feet or similar appendages, especially denoting a phase of insect larval development characterized by a segmented abdomen with rudimentary or functional appendages.
examples: the general prevalence of this polypod condition

origin: Mid 18th century (as a noun denoting an animal having many feet): from French polypode many-footed, from Greek polupous, polupod-, from polu- many + pous, pod- foot.
